name: Maple Butter Tarts
author: Inez Quinn
summary: These are a big hit every time I make them. They are an addition to a basket donated at a local fundraiser full of maple products. Sweet with a smooth flavor, they pair well with your favorite vanilla ice cream or whipped cream!
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Place tart shells on a baking sheet; sprinkle raisins evenly into the bottom of tart shells
Beat brown sugar and butter together in a bowl until smooth; whisk in eggs, maple syrup, flour, vanilla extract, and salt
Fill each tart shell 3/4 full with maple syrup mixture
Bake in the preheated oven until filling is set and shells are golden, about 16 minutes
Turn the baking sheet halfway through the baking time for even baking
